dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Performs a Relational less-than operation on two inputs on a cell-by-cell basis.
Returns 1 for cells where the first raster is less than the second raster and 0 if it is not. Learn more about how the Relational Math tools work

tool.name: LessThan
tool.summary:
Performs a Relational less-than operation on two inputs on a cell-by-cell basis.
Returns 1 for cells where the first raster is less than the second raster and 0 if it is not. Learn more about how the Relational Math tools work

pythonReference.para: The input being tested to determine if it is less than the second input.

A number can be used as an input for this parameter, provided a raster is specified for the other parameter. To be able to specify a number for both inputs, the cell size and extent must first be set in the environment.

dialogReference.para: The input being tested to determine if it is less than the second input.

A number can be used as an input for this parameter, provided a raster is specified for the other parameter. To be able to specify a number for both inputs, the cell size and extent must first be set in the environment.

pythonReference.para: The input against which the first input is tested to be less than.

A number can be used as an input for this parameter, provided a raster is specified for the other parameter. To be able to specify a number for both inputs, the cell size and extent must first be set in the environment.

dialogReference.para: The input against which the first input is tested to be less than.

A number can be used as an input for this parameter, provided a raster is specified for the other parameter. To be able to specify a number for both inputs, the cell size and extent must first be set in the environment.

pythonReference.para: The output cell values will be either integer 0 or 1; or NoData if any input cell value is NoData.

dialogReference.para: The output cell values will be either integer 0 or 1; or NoData if any input cell value is NoData.

bullet_item.para: Two inputs are necessary for this relational evaluation to take place.
The order of inputs is relevant for this tool.
In Map Algebra, the equivalent symbol for this tool is "<" ().

scriptExample.title: LessThan example 1 (Python window)
scriptExample.para: This example performs a Relational less-than operation on two GRID rasters and outputs the result as a TIFF raster.
scriptExample.code: import arcpy from arcpy import env from arcpy.sa import * env.workspace = "C:/sapyexamples/data" outLessThan = LessThan("degs", "negs") outLessThan.save("C:/sapyexamples/output/outlt.tif")

scriptExample.title: LessThan example 2 (stand-alone script)
scriptExample.para: This example performs a Relational less-than operation on two GRID rasters.
scriptExample.code:
# Name: LessThan_Ex_02.py # Description: Performs a relational less-than operation on two inputs # on a cell-by-cell basis within the Analysis window # Requirements: Spatial Analyst Extension # Author: ESRI
# Import system modules import arcpy from arcpy import env from arcpy.sa import *
# Set environment settings env.workspace = "C:/sapyexamples/data"
# Set local variables inRaster1 = "degs" inRaster2 = "negs"
# Check out the ArcGIS Spatial Analyst extension license arcpy.CheckOutExtension("Spatial")
# Execute LessThan outLessThan = LessThan(inRaster1, inRaster2)
# Save the output outLessThan.save("C:/sapyexamples/output/outlt")
